alert.note: Alert for East Carteret; Southern Craven; West Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Craven and central Carteret Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Great Neck, or 14 miles east of Havelock. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rain and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding of low lying areas will occur. Locations impacted include... South River, Merrimon, Great Neck, North Harlowe, Cherry Branch Ferry Terminal and Minnesott Beach Ferry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Carteret; Southern Craven; West Carteret
